explanation: The report is correct. In OS_TaskPrepare the local variable task is only used to read fields (task->entry_function_pointer) and no writes are performed through it, so it can and should be declared as a pointer-to-const (e.g. const OS_task_internal_record_t *task). Converting the address of the non-const global array element (&OS_task_table[index]) to a pointer-to-const is allowed by C and makes the intent explicit and compliant with MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13. The only reason not to make it const would be if some later operation in this function (or a callee using this pointer) needed to modify the object, which is not the case in the provided code.
